[h1]Good Game - Overpriced[/h1]

I paid $15 for this game. For that price, I would have expected hundreds of levels, and that isn't the case. The puzzles are fun, I enjoy the atmosphere, and the art is lovely, but I am a bit disappointed at this price point. I understand a 2D, animated puzzle game takes more effort than a 3D one. However, I would call this a $7-$8 game. There is a 'daily tidy,' but- if the first day is anything to go off of- they may just be rehashes of the levels themselves. I would definitely like to see this game be updated with more levels.

Wait for it to go on sale. The only reason I have 8 hours on it is because I let it sit up on my computer for a while; I could have realistically finished this in 1.5-2hrs. And, admittedly, some sequences feel a little bit [i]too[/i] drawn out, even for a slow, relaxing game like this. 

Credit sequence was very cute.
This game sparks that little happy organization part of my brain.

Definitely deserves a thumbs up from me. I had a small irritation about the achievements, but after acknowledging this in the discussions the developers actually listened and changed them. Big shoutout to developers that care and listen to their players
It's relaxing and elegant. I recommendi it :)
Very fun puzzles, relaxing music.

This definitely became one of my favorite casual puzzle games. Sadly, I finished way faster than I thought I would. The game was over in two hours, then I went back to try to figure out every possibility for multiple levels and another two hours passed and I finished the game again. Don't get me wrong, there is a lot of achievements available for those of you that like to 100% things, but that is where i usually draw the line at considering games completed. 
I hope that one day the daily tidies would be new levels rather than repeating the same levels played in the store. I understand that is kind of unreasonable to ask for, but something that is reasonable is asking for community puzzles which would be a really cool idea. 
Buy the game for a nice relaxing pass time game, replayability is kind of low, but it is still a great fun game. Get to pet cat and fulfill your OCD if you have it.

This easily became one of my favorite cozy games EVER! I played through the entire game in one go and I loved every bit of it! It was super satisfying and simple, while still being challenging enough to feel accomplished after finding all the different solutions. The puzzles were never enough to be irritating and the "let it be" feature was super nice, so I didn't feel bad at all for skipping a level and going back later. My only complaint is that the game doesn't have more levels because this game is an absolute delight!
Super relaxing and cozy puzzle game, loved it. Also love that there's more than one way to solve some of the levels. 10/10 would recommend.<3
so chilled with alot of thinking

I found this game, for the short time I played it, to be extremely stressful. I thought it would be relaxing but the fact that the organizational parts often make no sense and I frequently must rely heavily on the hints removes almost all of the relaxation and satisfaction. I cannot recommend this game if you want to relax.
the only bad part about this game is that it's too short. Calling all my neurodivergent folx- this game is IT.

I would recommend this as a simple light puzzle game. Nothing really hard or frustrating, but we all see different things and paths in puzzles. The game is short, but it is also not expensive. The cat finish was fun. The multiple solutions puzzles are nice. I liked doing that immediately so I remembered exactly which solution I just did. the daily tidy seems to be a puzzle, a variation thereof, of one of the existing puzzles. I've only seen a couple Daily Tidy thus far.

I have obsessive compulsive disorder
Five stars

***I REALLY LIKE THIS GAME***
I want to start off by saying I really like this game but for the sake of the review I want to say that the puzzles are either way too easy, or really complicated and like the similar game (unpacking) there is mainly only 1-2 "correct" ways to organize the things. I played the demo and wanted to love the game so much since I waited so long. I think it is a really good game but too  short, too expensive, and in same ways narrow minded since you can only complete the puzzles in a certain way. Also speaking on how short the game is, there isn't really any replay-ability.
Relaxing game

such a cozy little game to relax and enjoy. I love that every day there is a new challenge to do and the achievements keep me going back to play more. Sure it could have more puzzles with multiple solutions, but I'm satisfied with it anyways.

fun little game to satisfy boredom! love that you can go back and try other solutions to unlock more stars :) finished in a couple hours, took a few more to get all of the stars for each level. not sure if it's worth $25 given it's only a few hours of play, but it was enjoyable!
Jesus Christ, it feels so good.

While only about 3 hours of playtime, I had fun with A Little To The Left. For me, it's at its best when it's a puzzle game - the levels with multiple solutions in particle encourage some creative thinking. The levels about organising a large collection of objects are satisfying, too.

Where it falls down is levels which have no puzzle whatsoever (the constellations level and snowflake level in particular come to mind). These levels go from feeling like a puzzle based on a chore to being a chore. In addition, The Daily Tidy (alongside being the bane of all completionists and achievement hunters) pretty quickly became tedious for me. Daily Tidies based on good puzzles don't work (because you know the answer), but if they're based on non-puzzles (the last two Daily Tidies were constellations and snowflakes) then they're even more tedious than the original.

Speaking of non-puzzles, some levels simply involve arranging a bunch of stuff so there's symmetry, but the actual pattern you choose doesn't matter as long as the symmetry is there. This wasn't clear to me, and I think I only realised this was the case after completing all such puzzles with hints.

In addition, there's a few places where inputs seem finicky. You have the right solution, but you placed something slightly wrong or turned something a few degrees too much and the game doesn't acknowledge the solution (I think my biggest problem with this was on the alternative solution to the tomato cans). That said, this is rare.

As a final complaint, for a game where the coolest part is replaying levels with multiple solutions, the game always forces you onto the next level when you complete a puzzle for the first time. So if you want to replay it while it's still fresh in your head, you have to exit to the menu and reload the level.

Overall, this game is still excellent, I just wish they'd focused the experience more around the 3 Star levels and levels involving mass-tidying. Still a great game, highly recommend it while on sale.
Very gripping, before I knew it several hours had passed and I was close to the end, thankfully there are daily tasks as well as multiple ways to complete the puzzles.
This game was designed by a psychopath
Cats > Dogs

Scratches your brain in all the right ways- just not sure if it was worth 15 bucks for 3.3 hours of content. Puzzles were fairly straight forward, yet fun and satisfying. What really sold me was the art style/animations. but I'd recommend waiting till a sale. Thumbs up for cat, thumbs down for price ;/

I want to love this game. The art style is beautiful, the pace is pleasingly slow and the puzzles that work are brilliant. The puzzles that are the best in this game - the ones that require you to observe the screen carefully and apply a bit of logic - slowly disappear from rotation. This leaves a collection of puzzles with no place to start and no way to know you're going in the right direction without using the hints.

The hint system is very good, with the option to uncover the solution as much or as little as you like. I also appreciate the "Let it be" option, which lets you skip a level and come back to it later.

The satisfaction of solving a puzzle is quickly squashed by frustration when presented with objects or a puzzle layout that doesn't make sense no matter which angle you look at it from. It detracts from the clever mechanics of the puzzles that work. 

Perhaps worth picking  up on sale, but overall this is a disappointing puzzle game.

[h1] A Little Overpriced [/h1]
[hr][/hr]
Don't get it twisted, I [i] adored [/i] this game. The art is fantastic, the music is relaxing, and the controls are great. The price is a little much for how much content there is in the game. There is a daily play mode, where a new puzzle is unlocked each day, but after finishing the game in two sittings, I'm not sure I'm going to bother coming back to play a level that will only take 3 to 5 minutes to complete.
I'm not saying that the price is exorbitant or anything, but for what the game is, and how finicky some of the levels can be with precise placements, the price is a touch high.
If you are willing to spend $15 to fill a single afternoon playing an organizational puzzle game, then do it. It has the same vibe as Unpacking, but it's all about the puzzle of how things fit together. Plus you get to pet the cat in the last level.
I hate this game... Makes me do stuff i dont want to do
the cat drugs you

This game is seriously so much fun! I bought this game to hep me relax after a stressful week and I'm glad to say it really helped. I love how perfectly everything fits together each time, its so satisfying. The art and music are wonderful and I love noticing all the little details. I'm looking forward to playing the daily tidy each day to start my mornings!

If puzzles, cats, organizing, sorting, and have time to sit and rack your brains to focus and have fun then this game is right up your alley. The art is also unique and very comforting to look at with different type of different organizing puzzle situations. Some puzzles are lengthy because of difficulty however that is the fun of it. Some puzzles are short and easy to solve. Plus daily tidy option is always great to do once per day for a daily dose. Highly would play if you like the unboxing game and if you like to see the cat messing around in the game play. I love the cat <3

This game isn't as relaxing as I expected. Some of the puzzles are fun and have a nice challenge, some are not at all clear. Even after looking at the hint, which is just the solution, some objectives is still unclear. For example, Chapter 3 has a puzzle where you organize rocks and other random items. I had to look at the solution and I still had no idea what the criteria was for organizing the objects. I studied the solution and found no patterns, symmetry, etc. I know that there has to be some rhyme or reason to it, but if someone can't look at the solution and see the idea with minimal effort, the puzzle is too vague.

Also, as mentioned earlier, the hints are the solution. Even if you only clear a section of the page, the fun of figuring out the rest of the puzzle is lost. Maybe a general nudge in the right direction would be more helpful, such as images of symmetry for puzzles where the object is making the image symmetrical. I do appreciate that the solution is available when you are absolutely stuck, but having a few steps before then would be better.

The star system is also confusing as most people would assume the number of stars you have accumulated  would mean your completion score. In actuality, the stars represent the number of solutions you have found and the number possible. A lot of people who are drawn towards this type of game would like to achieve full completion and this vague star system is very frustrating until you learn what it really means.

Overall, a fun game but not the cute, laid-back game it is advertised as.

Hi, I bought the game yesterday and here's what I can say:

Playing the demo of the game, the puzzles were easy and fun. It applied towards the actual game, yet I was frustrated a bit with the other puzzles that weren't part of the demo. Of course, isn't the final product on where I should've seen that coming. I really suggest on having a helper or pattern to follow for the ( spoilers ) the leave cutting and item bundle matching segment where we needed to peek at the hint/answer to know what to do. You need to be very observant in the game to solve other segments, that's why perhaps instead of having the hint/cheat sheet in the menu. It could be just a helpful tip that will pop out for the player to know what to do instead for them to see the full answer on the spot.

I highly suggest the game if you liked unpacking, the way you organize and solve each round at the same time felt fulfilling much more the ending was the nicest way to end the game. 

 Overall, it was a nice cute game and will play again when I need to relax ^^

A lovely little collection of puzzles that were all either very soothing, quite clever, or both. Some of the puzzles have more than one solution, and invited thinking outside of whatever box I originally constructed for myself, and if I ever got impatient, the "Hint" option was a subtle but very helpful nudge forward. The art is pleasantly minimalist, the music is a nice calming background, and the sound FX give each puzzle quite a tactile feel - sometimes a bit too much, with some squelching and squashing noises that I could do with a little less of. Overall a sweet journey that made me feel both smart and at peace with everything, if only for a short time.

Disappointing. I had such high hopes for this game.

The best parts of the game feel like a more structured version of "Unpacking", with lots of cute little scenes to organize in an intuitive or a logical way. It's relaxing and scratches a very particular itch.

Then there's the rest of the game. A good number of the puzzle completely lacks the "intuitive" and "logical" parts of the above statement. The problem is that these puzzles insist on a "right" answer, even when there is no discernible reason for that right answer. For example: arrange a bunch of random seashells in a *very* specific way, with no way of knowing what the right way is. These puzzles are frustrating and demoralizing, and they kill the relaxing vibe of the game.
Hints might have softened the blow, but the "hint" system in the game just immediately tells you the "right" answer, removing any sense of accomplishment as soon as its used.

In closing: it's half of a very good little game. If you're the kind of person who isn't too bothered by just following directions in a puzzle game, or you're not bothered by skipping levels (at least there's a skip button!), then I can recommend giving this a look. Otherwise, maybe stay away.

As someone who played the demo when it came out, I am so happy with the final game! Can't wait for more levels (hopefully).. it was more puzzle based than the demo which was cool, but I would have preferred a few more organising levels personally :) absolutely adored the ending credits, super fun idea!

When I first was introduced to this game through the demo, I thought it would be mostly a satisfying, light puzzler similar to Unpacking, with the focus primarily on tidying things up instead of solving semi-difficult puzzles. The end result is more 50/50 - some of the puzzles and their multiple solutions come very naturally, and feel comfy like organizing a drawer.  That's where the game shines. But others were too abstract and necessitated guesswork or the hint button. This is frustrating because sometimes the "hint" is just a depiction of the solution. Based on the reviews, I was expecting the game to be maximum 2 hours, so I was pleasantly surprised when I was still finishing puzzles after twice that runtime. If you enjoyed the demo, I think it is worth paying full price for this version. My only strong negative about this game is the second to last puzzle which goes on for way WAAAYYY too long and nearly made me ragequit. It didn't help that it was the least fun puzzle in the game to boot. But overall, 7/10 would recommend.

I completed this in just under 4 hours, probably got about as much joy out of it as I would a movie. If you found the demo soothing it's worth a look but it's more of the same for the most part. The bits where it reaches further can sometimes be frustrating (especially in chap 4), because beyond creating a symmetrical arrangement  things don't 'fit' together as clearly and it feels like guessing unless you look at the hints - but then it's just duplication. 
Did I enjoy it? Yes. 
Should you pick it up? Maybe - if you're looking for a chill way to spend a few hours arranging stuff and don't mind it occasionally getting a bit existential. 
What would I recommend that's similar but better at scratching that itch? Unpacked.
An entrancing, short, cute and wholesome game. I do think it is a little overpriced, but I really enjoyed the game. Would buy again.

Most beautiful, calming game with the most realistic cat-behaviour ever!  It encourages thinking outside the box and looking at things from a different perspective.  A Little to the Left is an absolute must-play!
really fun and relaxing
Some people might think the price point is a little steep for what it is.. but if you're really into chill, cozy, and organizing then it's 10/10.

Absolutely incredible, this game really makes you think outside the box, whether it be once, twice, or three times on the same level. The sound effects, music, and animation style really piece this game together in the end. Definitely recommend if you want a head-scratching game that also aesthetically pleases. Worth every penny!
Love the replay value, and the daily tidy :3
this game has lowered my blood pressure and added years onto my life

[h1] [b] it's a bite-sized, casual bit of fun certainly worth the asking price. [/b] [/h1]

if you played the demo and liked it, the full game is more of that. be sure to fiddle with the sensitivity settings to make it so the items can move faster (the default is kinda slow).  a couple of the later levels are a bit abstract, but they put in a really neat hint system where you literally erase scribbles that are hiding the solution.
I love puttting things in their little places.............................................. sorting and tidying...............................

Really chill game to play when you can't sleep. It's the kind of puzzles where I don't play it for extremely difficult puzzles but more the experience of organizing and seeing a set of pencils or whatever in a satisfying manner. It's the kind of game to chill out to and enjoy the experience of stacking plates and matching patterns. More of a sensory experience.

Now, I do have only two complaints but they arn't terrible. I still think the game is worth the money.
[spoiler] Some puzzles such as the seashell one, leaf one and clover one drove me mad. The concept is to arrange these items in an appealing manner? Perhaps I didn't get it and there was some pattern in the grains of the wood or something but these seemed to not have a solution besides an appealing pattern the developer saw. if not for these puzzles then I would have had a hintless run. [/spoiler] 

On that note, the hints just showing you a solution is disappointing [strike] but necessary for the puzzles mentioned. [/strike]

Very much enjoyed the game. I would recommend it
There's the occasional obtuse/overlong puzzle, and I'm not 100% sold on the sound design, but otherwise just what I needed right now.

I wish this game was longer it was way too relaxing to be this short. Saying that, it took me 6 hours to complete the game including the multiple solutions to puzzles so I wouldn't say its too short, I just want more because I really like this game! 

Its really nice to just vibe and do little puzzles that don't require too much effort. The style is cute and the music is pretty. I had this on my wish list for a long time and I'm pleased with what was delivered :)

I gotta give it up to the marketing team, because I was so excited for this game. 
And then after buying it on release day, I was like "Oh wait, this is like a million other puzzle games."
Put the leaves color order. Make the spoons go smallest to largest. Turn the clock until a shadow in the background matches.
I've played that game. I've played that game a hundred times. Any game under "puzzle, casual, relaxing, cute" is going to be this exact game. The marketing made it seem like it reinvented the genre. It didn't. It's a "puzzle, casual, relaxing, cute" game. You hear those tags, you know exactly what the game is. ... And you don't really expect it to be $15 (and no discount on release day). 

Also, needing to get things pixel perfect is annoying. A lot of puzzle games will say "Ah, you're 92% of the way, we'll just jiggle everything a little for you to get it perfect, you obviously know the answer." It genuinely felt like it was every a good fourth of the puzzles in this game I would get the right answer, not proceed, look at the hint, see the hint was the answer I did, and have to jiggle everything around for a solid minute trying to get it *exactly* where they needed to be. 
Genuinely, my playtime is as long as it is for this exact issue. Specifically from the postcard puzzle, where I had the correct answer for 30 minutes and it just wasn't "clicking" into place. 

It was Unpacking in spirit, but not execution. I wanted to put things in a drawer the way I wanted to.
A cute little game that's more challenging than it looks!  A treat to play ^_^

Honestly my first preview of this game was on tiktok. Organizing the kitchen junk drawer. It looked perfect to be a simple, calming, organizational game, much like Unpacking. At first this game was neat. Definitely not worth the $15 price point, but whatever. 

The puzzles got frustrating incredibly quick. There's only one way to solve it, and no clues as to how to solve it. And half the time the answer doesn't make any sense. Or you can ask for a hint, and it just gives you the answer. Which is also frustrating. 

Now there is an option to just "Let it be" and you forfeit the star. Thats great for when you get frustrated, unless you just turn the game off and don't play it anymore, which is pretty much where I'm at. 

Good side, theres a cat. and thats probably the only thing you can count on being the same.

some of the puzzles are really easy and self explanatory, like organising books to smallest to largest, but other puzzles are pretty much impossible to solve unless you use the hint:/ one of the puzzles about a cobweb and organising flies doesn't even help to complete it with the hint. I was so excited to play this game but some of the puzzles are just stupidly hard to complete as there's no information to explain what to do. there's a lot of gameplay and lots of achievements but i feel like there should be explanations to the levels rather than the hint, just makes you feel like its cheating having to use the hint to get the answer on every other puzzle lmao

i want to love this game so bad

i was obsessed with the demo, and was excited for the full game so i could replay levels, but since the levels dont randomize, its the same exact scene/placements every time, theres no replayability and levels get old after just 1 or 2 plays. it sounds dumb but i was excited for the taking the stickers off the fruit one, but the stickers dont randomize where theyre located, so its just pulling the same sticker from the same spot over and over :( i love love love the concept AND execution, but i feel like adding some sort of 'endless mode' of things like sorting/cleaning/pulling stickers/etc would be absolutely perfect. this game has a lot of potential in terms of replayability if only a few things about the game would change imo. 

i do actually recommend the game, but not at the $15 it is now. i was initially hesitant for the full game based on the price knowing its a small game and im still trying to convince myself that it was worth it to spend that much. i love the game, dont get me wrong, but with only abt 3 hours of gameplay and no replayability, $15 unfortunately just doesnt feel right. a lot of the puzzles are just repeat ideas with different items (such as just making some shells/leaves/etc symmetrical) and get really monotonous. 

at the end of the day the price is what makes this game not worth it right now, replaying the demo every now and then could be enough for me.
Pretty relaxing game. It helps me unwind, its also easy to step away from and get back into. This is definitely replayable.
I've solved every level and there's still more to find! I love this game. The team did an incredible job creating a satisfying experience, from the controls to the visuals to the audio. 100000/10

Very good - relaxing, cute, good music. There's a few levels that have no rhyme or reason as to the solution (symmetry levels) and there's a few that I would have liked to have solved in different ways but wouldn't let me do alternate puzzle solutions. 

All in all, I enjoyed it, and the daily puzzle helps justify the price tag but, i also  just liked it and have been waiting for it since I saw the demo.
Loved the creativity in the puzzles you have to solve. I wish it were longer so I could play this more. It's well worth the money.
This is such a cute game! I loved every bit of it. I also like that you can get hints on levels if you're not exactly sure what to do.
My god I just spent 10 minutes dealing with stickers on fruit.  How High AM I?  I am SO HAPPY right now.

Loved playing A Little to the Left, completed the entire game in one sitting but that was because I was obsessed. You can go at your own pace and some of the tidy's (puzzles) are a little tricky so it's great that there is a "Let it be" option to just move on.

I thought we might get to see a little more of the cat or have some more puzzle interactions with it but still enjoyed all the puzzles where our furry friend appeared!

This is a great cozy game but remember it's still a puzzle game so you can't check out completely.
I had a 100% completion in four hours - this is a bit too little for the price. It could be because I'm autistic and good at categorization and pattern matching, but still...
Very relaxing and nice to look at. Sound design is great as well, very satisfying
A short little puzzle game that provides just enough of a challenge with the additional solutions.  Games like this make you feel nice and cozy after you're done.

Such a warm and cozy game. I love the sounds things make when you move them. I love the music. The puzzles are easy enough that you don't want to pull your hair out, but just hard enough that you have to spend a little bit of extra time on some of them. The cat adds that little piece of magic that makes you smile. It's just perfect. I only wish there was more of it. I could play this game all the time. Definitely worth the wait.
Was waiting for this game since demo! Incredible and fun, especially for people with adhd/autism. <3 100% recommend as its also on the fairly priced side of steam.

Honestly liked this game a lot, it wasn't very long but i don't mind that as long as the experience was good (:
Definitely would love more games in this category, recommend this!
Super cute and well rounded puzzles, makes you think in different perspectives.
Good game, also cat
sexy game. brain scratcher. me ocd likey

What a delightful little game. I remember seeing the very first trailer for this and was instantly in love. It's cute and short, and it made me very happy

Perfect for people with OCD. The sound design makes it all the better too
Relatively intuitive puzzles but still challenging. Excellent music and graphics. 10/10
This game is so amazing, the design and the soundtrack are incredible. If you like sorting games this is a must buy!!
Cute yet challenging, a good game for the morning to get my brain moving!

Very interesting and fun.  Had no bugs or issues for me.  A few head scratchers to 100% it, but mostly it was a relaxing couple hours of play.  Not sure thats worth 15 bucks (maybe 10-12 in my opinion but there were a lot of people working hard on this so maybe its worth the price to have no other issues and enable everyone to get decent pay?), but other than the price point, I honestly have no complaints.  If you are looking for something relaxing to keep your interest while you sip some tea, this would be a good game.  Looking forward to hopefully future dlc.

I liked most of the puzzle that were in the game, but there disliked the parts where you had to arrange a set of items so they were symmetrical, so I do appreciate the included "let it be" option. Even though the game was shorter than what I would have liked, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes to solve puzzles and has a few bucks to spare. I hope that there will be most games like this from the developer but if only a little longer.
honestly this game was more frustrating than fun or relaxing lol
Hi, I just played for 5.6 hours straight. My brain is very happy, thank u.

A relaxing, organizational puzzle game with soothing music. There are sometimes multiple solutions to a puzzle (indicated by the number of stars), and I think that's better than there being just one solution. It allows for more creative thinking. It is an adjustment to be thrown into a puzzle with no direction, but it never feels punishing to use a hint. The activity of unlocking the hint is fun within itself, and sometimes you'll see the solution and get that, "oh duh, of course!" All puzzles have the same "solution" just in a different environment, but it never feels boring. 
It's a short game but with the daily challenges, I think it is absolutely worth the price tag. And there's a cat. That automatically earns 5 stars.

Had a lot of fun organizing things :D!! 
Only bad thing is that the hints just straight up tell you the solution, I wish they were more hints to help me figure it out myself instead of just telling me what to do.
Very fun, creative and cute - loved seeing multiple ways the levels can be solved. The game is also very easy!
i thought it was a relaxing game of tidying with the option to do it all your way and not a puzzle game with one solution.

Pros:

Cute, wholesome few hours of fun, especially for fans of Unpacking. I think it's a little pricey for a 3-ish hour game plus daily levels that are just reskins of the levels you have already played, but I don't regret my purchase.

Very zen game, with relaxing music and engaging puzzles. Some puzzles can be a little obtuse, especially when you discount a solution you tried, because you were only a few pixels off from the correct answer.
Incredibly cryptic for a game that's meant to be cozy and relaxing.
makes you forget about reality for a while

Nice and fun puzzle game, with cute music and graphics. Puzzles are fairly simple. 
Only downside is that it's a really short game, approx 3 hours gameplay, therefore I would recommend getting it on sale, as it is pricey for what content it has. It does have a "daily puzzle" feature, but it can usually be solved in under 5 mins and sometimes are a repeat of some of the story puzzles.
This game is soo cute and fun! I love it! I recommend this to those who want a chill and relaxing game, AND for cat lovers out there! Haha!

I really wanted to like this game but... I don't think I do.

I think there should be more than one 'answer' for most if not all of the puzzles and went in thinking it would be a lot more freeform than it is. It falls short on being relaxing or challenging and is somewhere in the middle around 'mildly annoying/boring.' It feels like there no real 'reward' or satisfying 'ah ha!' moment when figuring out what the level wants you to do and rarely does the puzzle feel fun to do. Its a lot of 'push stuff around until the game tells me I did it right' and then move on to the next. 

I am up to chapter three right now and I do like it more than the previous levels, (it feels like I'm actually using my brain a little bit on these ones!) but at this point I'm hesitant to recommend the game. Maybe wait for a sale if you're really keen.
Incredibly fun and satisfying little game. I really enjoyed the chill music and atmosphere while solving all the different kinds of puzzles.

This game is a ton of fun! Really clever puzzles that made me think and look for patterns I wouldn't normally think of right away! I played with friends and it was interesting to see how similarly or differently we approached certain puzzles! I definitely highly recommend this cozy game!

I was so excited for this game to come out and it met all of my expectations! It took me 3 hours to finish the game and I have to say the sounds and the background music were so relaxing! The implementation of the cat was adorable! I do wish the achievements for this game weren't private so I can see what I'm missing, but I'm sure that information will be released in a guide soon enough.

The soundtrack and art are very pleasant and nice, the levels are short yet numerous enough to feel like a full game, and the levels themselves are satisfying in a way that their generally low difficulties are not drawbacks. The option to skip a level and come back later is monumental for preventing the occasional hard level from breaking your momentum. You can bet I'll be replaying this and scampering all over it for all of those achievements). Also, the developers truly understand cats on a deep level.
10/10 you get to pet the cat

It's good, and comfy, and unfortunately maybe a bit overpriced for how short it is.  The puzzle backgrounds could do with a bit more visual indication of where to put things sometimes too, instead of just being barren but having clearly designed 'slots' stuff will snap to.  Overall though it's basically exactly what it looks like on the tin, so if it seems interesting to you, you're probably the target audience.

I really enjoyed this game! It took my mind off of my hectic school schedule and let me relax for a couple hours. There were some puzzles that I didn't understand, but thankfully the game allows hints instead of having to pull up google or a playthrough. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who just needs a distraction for a couple hours.

Fun little puzzle game. It took me close to seven hours to complete all the puzzles at 100%. I got so much joy in the hours I did play, so to me, the price was worth it. Definitely recommend it for those people who like cats, cute music, and puzzles.

ive been watching this game since its demo and am so glad its finally out!! it had such a nice demo that had a beautiful art style and fun puzzles and the full game kept that intact! some of the puzzles alternate solutions are quite hard to understand (i still dont get the answers for a few...) but i loved it!

ps. if you need help with solutions, try 'crystal dreams' on youtube! <3

The puzzles are fun. There are some easy and some medium difficulty. The only thing I wished there was more of was more chapters or mini games included. Otherwise, I loved the game and graphics. It was super cute.
This game is so satisfying! I'm so glad they added the daily tasks because I couldn't stop playing and played the whole game in one day but at least I still have something to do!

It's like their demo had the best level taken out of each section of the game. Not having guidance in an organization game is fine, but this one gets so abstract that you don't know what you're doing. they give you *some* indication by making things click in place, which doesn't really feel satisfying and it feels even worse when a cat knocks over all of your work. It feels like if I don't know what the puzzle solution is i can just wave my mouse all over the place until something clicks. The worst puzzle so far is the one with the [spoiler] cat pictures [/spoiler]. I still don't understand it. There should be a better hint system. they are NOT hints, they are quite literally just the solution for the puzzle. I thought and hoped that this game was going to be a satisfying calming organizing game but it's a puzzle game, which wasn't what was displayed with the puzzles shown in the demo which we're more focused on easy calm organization. One might question, maybe I'm just bad at puzzles? Let me show you the [spoiler] cat photo [/spoiler] puzzle or quite a few in this game and see if you can solve them with no hints or context on what is supposed to be done.
Game of the year!
This is just the game my anxiety needed. It is so satisfying to see everything lined up and the little bonus levels for the story made me giggle. I love it so much

Short but nicely tricky puzzles, all clearly designed with love. This game will absolutely satisfy the kind of person who likes adjusting picture frames and organising your knickknack collections in various ways. 

I can understand the concerns with pricing in relation to how much gameplay you actually get, but considering the amount of people and time (and creativity!) that made this, I absolutely think it was worth the price. 

A solid 9.8/10, would highly recommend!

I've been looking forward to this game for a looooong time. Just bought it and I'm loving it. I got through half of it in my first sitting and I can't wait to keep going! Bravo to the devs.

Update after completing all the puzzles: This game is grrrreat! The final chapter has some very wacky and clever puzzles. Overall, I completed all the puzzles in 3.6 hours. Great game!
I love this game

I enjoyed this game thoroughly! It's a lovely relaxing puzzle game with a nice score and soothing game play. While none of the levels were too particularly puzzling, some of the multiple solution levels took awhile to work through all the solutions. Despite that, everything had an easy to follow logic and I had gotten stumped on components I overlooked. The game is well priced for the content and I can easily see myself playing favorite levels again like Unpacking. 

I am still working through the remaining achievements and looking forward to daily puzzles!
Very fun, cute game! Incredibly relaxing, and a few of the puzzles have decent replay value, like the open-ended ones where you make a mirrored art piece. The cat is my favorite character!

[quote] A Little to the Left is a wonderfully charming puzzle game, made especially for those who take great joy in organizing things. It can be frustrating in quite a few of the puzzles, but itâ€™s an overall enjoyable and very relaxing experience! [/quote]

â€œA little to the leftâ€ is both a phrase that I hear way too often when helping my mom change furniture around in her house, which she does at least once every couple of months, and the name of an [b]incredibly charming little puzzle game made by a two person team called Max Inferno.[/b]

I know I joked about the whole furniture thing, but honestly, Iâ€™m pretty sure that precise scenario is where the developer got the name of the game from. You see, [b]the game is all about organizing things,[/b] with the very first level being all about fixing a picture that needs to be tilted just a little to the left. I see what you did there, devs! Honestly, I love the name of the game. It fits.

But what DOES it fit into, exactly? What is the full package? Well, [b]A little to the left is a puzzle game that consists mostly of organizing things.[/b] You have a level select screen with over 75 quick levels that give you a variety of objects that you need to organize within whatever frame the level provides you with. If you get a bunch of books side by side, for example, youâ€™ll know youâ€™ll probably have to shift the books around to organize them in a way that makes sense, be it by size, cover design, whatever. On another level, youâ€™re given stickers to apply to a calendar, or stamps to apply to letters. Whatever the case, [b]the levels usually have a pattern, something to nudge you in the right direction, and itâ€™s up to you to find out what you have to do. But do take note of the fact I said usually, because unfortunately, itâ€™s not always like this.[/b]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2886559479

[b]See, while quite a few of the puzzles are very intuitive, some of themâ€¦ arenâ€™t.[/b] The worst were the ones that just gave me an empty space and a bunch of objects. In those, youâ€™re supposed to arrange the objects in the right way, except as far as I can tell, thereâ€™s only one way to find out the correct arrangement, and thatâ€™s via trial and error. [b]And thatâ€™s not just me saying, quite a few of the reviews are in the same boat as me, which is the I-sometimes-find-it-hard-to-tell-what-goes-where boat.[/b] The game does try to alleviate this by having a kind of a snap effect to an object when you put it in the right place, along with a DING sound that plays, but for me, that was simply too inconsistent to rely on.

[b]Thankfully, though, the game has a handy hint feature, which I unashamedly used for all the levels I found unintuitive.[/b] Well, I say hint because thatâ€™s the name in the game, but the truth is the hint is actually the entire answer of the puzzle, but itâ€™s displayed in a way that can be a hint. Itâ€™s quite brilliant, really. Let me explain. The answer is basically written in a notebook, but scribbled over. You can get an eraser and erase all the scribbles, which reveal the puzzleâ€™s answer. However, if you only want a hint, you can choose to erase just part of the scribbles, and reveal just a bit of the answer. This way, the player has full control over how much help they want, and I find that to be pretty cool.

[b]The game also has multiple solutions for some puzzles, which are shown via a star system.[/b] Basically, you complete a puzzle and you get a star. However, if you complete a puzzle and you see there are two or more stars to get, that means there is another solution to your level. Just like with the puzzles, the solutions can also be unintuitive sometimes. However, in this case, not even the hint will help you, as the hint only shows you the answer to one of the solutions. The rest is on you. [b]While I do enjoy the star system that easily shows you the number of solutions a puzzle has, the game doesnâ€™t actually explain this anywhere. It doesnâ€™t really explain much of anything at all, in fact.[/b] In a game as simple as this, in which you play by clicking and dragging your mouse, thatâ€™s mostly okay, but this fact can generate some confusion in some areas, such as the stars. Iâ€™ve seen players for example who thought these stars were ratings, and that they were being too slow/doing something wrong.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2886559204

[b]In terms of story, there isnâ€™t really one, and thatâ€™s okay. This is a very casual puzzle experience made especially for people who are really into organizing their spaces.[/b] If you finish all the content of this game and want more, fret not: [b]the game does have a daily puzzle system,[/b] so at least once a day you can hop back in and do that. In this vein, the game is very relaxing. [b]The graphics are adorable and very cozy, with a soundtrack that feels at times upbeat and at times like a warm hug.[/b] The game is very good at making you feel like your worries are melting awayâ€¦ if you donâ€™t get frustrated at some of the puzzles.

[b]While I did enjoy my time with A Little to the Left, I do believe this game isnâ€™t going to be for everyone.[/b] For me, the puzzles varied wildly in quality, with the best ones being very intuitive and a nice challenge in figuring out how to accomplish your objective, and the worst ones being the ones in which you have no idea nor clue what youâ€™re even meant to do, or, even worse, the empty space ones in which you know what you have to do but have no way to tell which object goes where in the gameâ€™s preferred organization. Thankfully, I found more intuitive puzzles than I found the other type, but there were still many more of the latter than I think should have been.

If you think youâ€™re okay with this caveat I mentioned, then youâ€™ll probably find this game very relaxing, much in the vein of Unpacking, if you played that. But if you tend to get frustrated when a game wants a different solution than your perfectly valid one, or upon feeling that a puzzle might be unfairâ€¦ then it might be best for you to steer clear of this title. For me, I had a good time, even with the frustration. Certainly commendable work, especially for a 2 person team. If you do pick up the game, I do hope you enjoy it. And if you want to talk about the game, Iâ€™m always down to chat! You can find me just a little to your left. â€¦ Iâ€™m so sorry. Iâ€™m actually probably thousands of kilometers away but I really wanted to make the joke.

good and cute :)

I do love the idea, and was drawn to this game because of my frustration with the short length of Unpacking and how there were so many "wrong" ways to organize things. 

However, I wasn't expecting to encounter the idea that there are a bunch of wrong ways to organize things in this game as well. When there's a stack of books of the same height, I thought color and size was an appropriate way to organize. Apparently, you have to make the colors link in a way it wants as well. This carried on, and various other little things.

Frustratingly, there's no words or anything that would tell you how the game works. Nothing that says "sometimes there is more than one way to organize this one" or "this one only has ONE correct way, despite how many ways you can think of."

Maybe if you aren't going to be bothered by every organization idea you try being wrong, then this would work for you. For me, some of them are quite the stretch and the lack of information + possible time limit affecting my star score? It's confusing, if nothing else. I don't personally find it comforting to race and try as organize as fast as possible.

Was enjoyable for a while but I don't think I'll pick it up again. Some of the puzzles were a little difficult but they just started becoming the same puzzle over and over again just with different objects. I like it and it is a cute basic idea but it's not for me.

Fun, cute, mostly easy puzzle game with decent accessibility.
The large symmetry puzzles feel arbitrary to me though, I don't get them.

I loved the demo! this game is ment to be repentive and its just a nice game to play on a lazy day when you need to relax ill be honest i wish there was more but hopefuly they will add more in future updates and a few puzzles were not intouitive but i used the hints and that helped. i did finish the whole game in 3 hours be hey i loved it . i wish i knew what the stars meant and what not. also wish i knew the name of the main cat but all in all a very nice calming and relaxing game

i loved playing through this game and figuring out all the puzzles, especially the ones that make you think for a little while. finally understanding the objective on a level and seeing it organized in an appealing way make for a very satisfying experience. i just wish there were more levels. it took me about 3 hours to complete one star on all the levels, so i'm hoping some new content gets released in the future.
Really great and relaxing tidying puzzle game. I would like puzzle games if they were more like this. You can skip a level if you are stuck, and they even give hints if you want them.

I had this game on my wishlist for several months and was really looking forward to the release. Now that I've actually played it and experienced all of the puzzles, I'm almost.. disappointed?

I know this game is supposed to get you to think but I was only able to find some of the solutions because of the little chime clue. Even after looking up the answer to some of the levels, I still couldn't understand the reasoning behind them.

The game looks cute, the idea behind it is great and some of the puzzles were also good, especially the sorting ones with the tools and office supplies. However, one of the biggest issues for me was the sound. Sometimes the sound was so repetitive and distracting that I had to lower the volume on my headphones. A friend of mine watched me stream to Discord and had to stop watching because he couldn't take the sounds of the game anymore.

I wish I could've liked it as much as I thought I would but I sadly can't recommend this game.
I feel at peace after playing this game. If you have ADHD, autism, or both, I can't recommend this game enough. I haven't felt this content in forever. Thank you for making this.

This game has a lovely artistic design and feel, but overall if left me wanting. I think the game does not scratch my ocd itch as much as other games in this genre simply because each 'puzzle' is not always intuitive. Makes it more a figure out what to do game rather than a relaxing scratch that itch game. Thankfully maybe only 1/3-1/4 of the game suffers from this in my opinion (mirror image puzzles and clip the vines I'm mainly looking at you).

A satisfying romp through simple ordering puzzles (and some not simple ones, the alternate solutions get real abstract and are the game's main optional challenge)
Everyday you get a remix of a main game puzzle, so, system clock shenanigans aside, you might end up playing this over a year
I will say that, due to the abstract nature of some puzzles, they can feel a little inscrutable at times, but the game is generous with hints to compensate

I recommend this game if you want to relax and play something stress-free and enjoy it!
The atmosphere is lovely, soundtrack is soothing, puzzles are fun.
oh my go d yesmmmmmm

My only issue with the game is I wish there was more ways to solve each puzzle, although the creativity on display here is already impressive. The last minute inclusion of a skip feature was a good idea :P
Super cute puzzle game!

I really wanted to like this game, and I think it has a lot of merit. The game's style is really cute and very well crafted. It is visually very strong and what drew me into the game to begin with.

However, I just can't say the same about the puzzle design. I understand it is first and foremost, a puzzle game where you have to find the "catch". But it advertises itself as a relaxing organisational experience and it's not really that. Some puzzles only have one set answer even if you can craft many different ways to organise the scene.

I found myself frustrated as I can't figure out why my answer wasn't correct, after a few times of feeling this way I just couldn't keep playing. The real answers are too abstract and sometimes feel arbitrary. Sometimes I would just stumble upon these "real answers" randomly because of the items snapping into place and playing an audio cue.

I think a way that could make this game feel better to play is allow more and looser answers to all puzzles. Let the players experiment and find all the possible solutions. When I'm done with a level, instead of moving me forward, let me retry and fiddle around and see what different and abstract answers I can make up.

The "let it be" option is a good design choice but feels unsatisfying to click when I've made my own answer.

I feel like the whole time I'm cleaning someone else's house with their rules instead of my own spaces which makes the game feel tedious unintentionally. 

It's a cute game if you like abstract puzzles that look pretty, not really for those looking for a zen and carefree experience.

A very fun and satisfying game. Some of the puzzles can be a bit difficult or finicky, but I've only found myself having to check the hints a couple of times so most of the puzzles are easily solved by moving things around and trying to think outside the box
This game is really fun if you've got a lot of thought when it comes to sorting - or you simply just like tidying things up. I recommend it to people who like this sort of game(s)

If you like Unpacking, you may like this game.
Considering price and content, recommend it only when on sale unless you are extremely addicted to tidying things up.

TL;DR: If logic puzzles are your cup of tea, give A Little to the Left a shot. Just make sure you read lots of reviews or watch a let's play or two so you get a good sense of the game's difficulty before buying.  If you're looking for a more dollhouse-like experience similar to Unpacking, skip this one.

Many of the puzzles are fun and give you a sense of accomplishment when solved. Others are IMPOSSIBLE to figure out without hints (thank goodness for the 'ding' and items snapping to the grid as self-corrects), making the game more frustrating than fun. I stumbled my way to more than one solution before I even knew there were actual hints available in the pause menu. Even then, I didn't always understand what I did to get the puzzle right. I suspect many of you are smarter and far more patient than I am, so your mileage may vary.

As other players wrote, the demo doesn't set the right expectations for the the difficulty of the full game. The art style and music are lovely, and the levels that allow you to sort, order and organize just so are a blast. Less enjoyable are the rage-quit worthy-logic puzzles scattered throughout an otherwise chill game.

I had been anticipating the release of this game for MONTHS! I bought it the second it came out and was not disappointed. It's challenging and infuriating but so rewarding and worth it when you've finished each puzzle. I highly recommend it.

I hoped this would be another zen game like Unpacking. I was sadly mistaken.

I want to like this game very badly, but I just can't in good conscience recommend it to anyone. The idea of having little guidance is fine in theory, but more than a handful of puzzles are so abstract in what they expect out of you as to be baffling. And I say this as someone on the spectrum, when even I struggle to see the pattern they want, you might have messed up.

A nice and relaxing casual experience, if a bit short (as of this review, I have fully solved every puzzle in the game except for the stupid candle one. You'll know it when you see it). If you like games in the same vein as Unpacking, PowerWash Simulator, or Animal Crossing, you'll probably like this too.

Thought I would love this game from the demo but honestly it did not live up to my expectations. It's good at first but then it gets repetitive, and there's a few puzzles that I really have no clue how you're supposed to figure out without the hint- [spoiler] Like the puzzles where you trim leaves, or the tool shed one [/spoiler] 
I don't know if I will bother to continue to play (im in chapter 4) or if I should just refund it.

I'm disappointed
OCD people please buy this game..
Delightful!
NEED MORE PLEASE

I played the demo awhile back and instantly was in love. I'm very happy to see this game out now. I've played a lot of different puzzle games and this one is unique. Really scratches that itch to straighten and sort things. Some of the puzzles are head-scratchers, but it's good to stretch the mind. They balance out the soothing, easy puzzles. The music and art style is great too. For those wondering if the price is too steep, remember it's made by just two people who spent a lot of time working on something fresh for the puzzle realm.

The puzzles don't make sense!!! I mean you will figure out pretty quickly, but for a game that is suppose to make you feel good about putting things away, or fixing, it does the OPPOSITE!  You want books in a row by height? Guess what? No you gotta put them in a different way, the puzzle said no and so did my brain.
Very cozy
i love organization games, there needs to be more games like this one & Unpacking. This game also has cat. I love cat.

I have had my eyes on this game for quite a while, I think I first saw it on a wholesome direct and it felt like someone had made a game specifically for my weird enjoyment of menial virtual tasks. I thought it would just be a nice little organisation game, something satisfying. But it's also a fantastic puzzle game! I don't think it's super hard but I've had to take time to think and I absolutely love that for some levels there are a number of different ways to solve them and you can go back to get the other methods. While I think you could probably work your way through the game pretty fast there seem to be daily challenges coming out, at least a year is planned for this it seems so there's a lot of content. So if you want a chill and not too tricky puzzle game (at least what it seems like from the early levels) I really think this game is worth your money.

Also the art is super charming, the music is chill and my silly little reptile brain gets pleased by ordering things nicely.

Not at all what i expected. Hard to tell what goes where, placement for things sometimes make no sense, where stuff is supposed to "click in" is hard to find. Overall i expected more since the demo was good.

I saw Gab Smolders play the demo and I knew I needed this game when it was fully released. Finally its out and the game is cuter than I remembered! 
The puzzles/tasks are simple and easy, and when you can't figure it out the hint always tells you enough to figure it out. The small story throughout the game is so cute, and the whole gave overall if very relaxing! 
This is for sure one of my top 3 favourite games now!

As someone who absolutely loves games that revolve around organization, puzzles and just wholesome content, a little to the left had everything. I expected for it to be a quick play, as most games like this are, but the levels just kept coming and I couldn't have been happier. I'm sad that its over but can see myself playing it again, if you enjoy games like unpacked or assemble with care...this is probably right up your alley.
i like it. fair price for what u get - just sad cause i wanted more :( but very good game
Satisfying.

This little game is adorable! The puzzles were very cute and challenging. I very much appreciated the hint mechanic, it made it easy for me to keep from getting frustrated.
The game is a little on the short side, but I'd still recommend picking it up if you want a cozy, fun experience. The art is very charming and It's evident all the love that went into the game.

- Solutions to some puzzles feel... random / you don't really know if you are on the right track
- First game that really made me hate the cat that was in it... so congrats, I guess?
- It looks cute and is really enjoyable in parts, but yeah, not so much fun overall
I really like games like this and this game is a thumbs up for me. It satisfy my ocd!
i love cleaning and organizing in games instead of irl! great stuff!

This is easily the most satisfying game I have ever played. Short and sweet, but VERY replayable. The audio was my favorite part of this game. I could sit and click on the golf balls all day. Don't be afraid to use the hints. Shout out to the Devs. Y'all did an amazing job!
It's a cozy and relaxing puzzle game that has a cat! What's not to love about it? But really though, this is one of the best puzzle games I have played in my life. It's 100% worth it.
fun

A pretty quick play. some of them are pretty hard to figure out without the hint. I really like just being able to organize everything, ive been waiting for this game for months and im not disappointed. definitely can be replayed. also love that theres a "daily tidy" to keep me coming back after finishing the game. very cute and very beautiful
I love telling my imaginary kitty off for messing up my table set
A very gentle little game. Cozy!

wish there was more organizing stuff, very cute game love the graphics. would buy on sale though
Very fun, relaxing, and satisfying puzzle/organization game. If you like games like Unpacking you'll probably enjoy this.
Impulse buy, good stuff, especially if a fan of Unpacking

ive been wanting to play this game for a while now and i was so extited to see it was released!! super fun really enjoyed it!! if you like sorting things you'll like the game!! one small detail i really liked was how the hints were deliverd,, super cute!! 
   (it took me 2.8 hours to play though it once, there is more content tho)

A Little to the Left is a text-free zen puzzle experience, with a surprising amount of depth and challenge to it.  If you're expecting narrative with mindless puzzles thrown in, that is not what you're going to get...  be prepared to get stumped again and again!

Even more involved are getting all in-game stars and all Steam achievements.  I'm very impressed by this game; much moreso than I was expecting to be!

I'm about halfway through the game (I think), and enjoying it so much. It's very fun and satisfying. There are so many different levels that I think it's worth the price. Some of the levels feel more like organization, while others feel like I'm solving a puzzle, and are even a bit challenging to figure out how to complete the level. But so far there's a good enough hints system that I haven't gotten stuck anywhere.
I'm too dumb for this game
This game is so stinking sweet, with incredible sound and art design. Very like Unpacking but even more satisfying!

Been following the progress of this game since seeing it on TikTok. Played the demo a few days ago and immediately fell in love with the game. The controls, the art style, the sound design, the puzzles themselves: all wonderful. I was literally counting down the hours on Steam until release and bought it as soon as I could, and then played an hour and a half straight after installing. Safe to say I am in love with this game and look forward to not only completing it, but 100%-ing and achievement hunting with it.

I played the demo which seemed fun but extremely easy, I assumed the full game would be a bit more fun and more indepth. It was just a repeat over and over with different objects. It is not worth 20 dollars canadian.

Been eagerly anticipating this release since the demo. This is a relaxing and engaging puzzle game. Love the music and aesthetic. The hint system is also very helpful for some more obscure puzzles. The daily tidying is also nice. Recommend picking this up :)
Oh I absolutely love this game. I had been looking for something else that was similar to unboxing and this is about as close as I could ask for. It's relaxing, no stress involved. I'm in love.
